utterances.utterance: CAIR was founded after 9/11 because they recognized that some people did something, and that all of us were starting to lose access to our civil liberties.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Freshman Democratic lawmakers now rushing to Omar's defense. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez attacking the New York Post for responding to Omar with this cover. Watch.

utterances.speaker: REP. ALEXANDRIA OCASIO-CORTEZ, D-N.Y.
utterances.utterance: Printing on the front page to circulate all around New York City an image that is incredibly upsetting and triggering for New Yorkers that were actually there, and were actually in the radius that woke up one morning or were in their schools and didn't know if they were going to see their parents at the end of the day to elicit such an image for such a transparent and politically motivated attack on Ilhan. This is -- we're getting to the level where this is an indictment of violence against progressive women of color.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And Rashida Tlaib also claiming Omar is being unfairly targeted.

utterances.speaker: REP. RASHIDA TLAIB, D-MICH.
utterances.utterance: They do this all the time to us, especially women of color. They do that. They take our words out of context because they're afraid because we speak truth. We speak truth to power. This is just pure, racist acts by many of those -- hateful acts by those because she does speak truths when it talks about different issues that they don't disagree with, and I'm really outraged.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: One of the first people to come out against Omar's comments is Congressman Dan Crenshaw who lost an eye fighting terrorists in Afghanistan. AOC is facing new backlash for this twitter attack on the decorated war hero, telling him to, quote, go do something about domestic terrorism. Omar also dragging President George W. Bush into the controversy with this tweet, the people and the people who knocked these buildings down will hear all of us soon. Was Bush downplaying the terrorist attack? What if he was a Muslim? So a lot to unpack here, Greg. Let me start with you in terms of what -- George W. Bush was sending a warning to the terrorists.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah, she's not very good about -- Jesse is the king of what- about-isms. She's the worst at it. That was a terrible -- that was a terrible what-about-ism.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It didn't work.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Look, here's her problem. She's too casual about something that everybody takes really seriously. Let's assume that she knows that 9/11 is a bad thing. I think she does. The problem is she's interested in -- more interested in what happened afterwards. And what that does is by shifting the emphasis and the priority to that, it makes it seem like she cares less about 9/11. And the weird thing, I think, that I find troubling and persistent because she's made this mistake a number of times is that she finds an attachment to the never-forget element kind of tiresome. It's like when she was critiquing people about the way they say al-Qaeda, and how they overdramatize it. It was like she was saying that you place too much importance on the threat of terror, because, in her mind, the real importance about her as a victim. And so, even here when they're talking about like -- you better not criticize her because she could become a victim of something. It's like -- well, we could just say the same thing about the very criticisms you say about us.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It is interesting to watch how like Congressman Dan Crenshaw and AOC and the other like -- they go back and forth on twitter and it's kind of strange, but kind of good to see the fight.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, HOST
utterances.utterance: Yeah. I don't think she's fighting fair because she blames every attack on her being a black female Muslim refugee instead of actually addressing what she said. To Greg's point, I think the impression that she was giving off was she cared more and thought that Islamophobia was a bigger threat than radical Islam. And no one actually believes that. I don't think she's a hero. I also don't think she's a victim. I think she's a below average talent who doesn't have the sensibility to survive very much longer in Congress. She's a lightning rod.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: How do you know that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't she's going to last. I'll tell you why because she's already on double-secret probation and she's --

utterances.speaker: GERALDO RIVERA, HOST
utterances.utterance: Low intelligent individuals.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And I think if she wasn't friends with AOC the rest of her caucus would just cast her aside because she's not worth the trouble.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: She's one of the first two Muslim women in Congress that's going to cast her aside --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: She's been much more of a headache --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, she was very dismissive at about 9/11, and a lot of people take that very seriously especially the newspaper in Manhattan. And if any newspaper is going to put that on the front page, I think the New York Post has complete license to do that. What I don't like is that she never really acknowledges what she says when she's attacked. She says you're only attacking me because of my identity not what I actually said. And that's like playing sports against someone, they're always complaining to the ref. You know, they're getting dominated play after play after play and they're always whining to the referee. She just does not have the talent, I don't think, to stand in the ring and fight.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: This is not whining when she's being attack -- like, this is an existential threat. She's getting death threats --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What's an existential threat?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: She's getting death threats on a daily basis.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: When you -- the bar is low.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know the bar is low now.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I'm a New Yorker. I understand --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: As a New Yorker I understand you speak with solemn, hushed tones when you talk about 9/11. I lost friends and neighbors on 9/11. I get it. It is awful, 343 firefighters, 71 cops, I get it. It's a mass murder -- mass grave downtown. She doesn't have the glibness, the language of a veteran who knows that this is the proper response when you're talking about something as horrific, as traumatic as 9/11 that screwed up all of our lives for the worst. I think that she really -- this is beginning to sound a lot like when the - - my first presidential election, 1960, Kennedy being attacked because he was Catholic, and they said he's going to have allegiance to Rome rather than to the United States. I smell the same stink here.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Geraldo, if this is a white guy saying this -- a white straight, male Christian freshman Democrat congressman, you don't think the Republicans would be running up the score on something like that? They'll be doing the exact same thing.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: It's a gotcha. I mean, let her learn on the job. Give her a break, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Steep learning curve already.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So, a couple of things. One, I'll ask Emily respond to this. To go after President George W. Bush, right? Like, of all people in a position of power. The leader of the free world at that time went out of his way to make sure that it was clear that he did not think that all Muslims were terrorists. That's what he meant. And when he was talking about them like those people, when he was talking about the actual people who perpetrated the act.

utterances.speaker: EMILY COMPAGNO, HOST
utterances.utterance: Well, that's why I think -- yes, and why so many of these statements are so false, it's based on such a lack of education of the entire situation. And what frustrates me is reducing -- it's hiding the ball, 100 percent is whining to the ref. It's 100 percent being a distraction because I don't see it as afraid to speak truth to power. It's pure racist. These are comments from freshmen congresswomen. When do they become empowered? When will they actually write legislature? Because, guess what, we are their bosses and that's what they are there to do. I think especially on the attack on -- to me that is an attack on Representative Crenshaw when he served his country for 10 years, literally gave limb for it and he is supposed to somehow be the butt of their attacks in terms of, oh, do more? He's the one also that reached across the aisle to average Americans when he was attack publicly, and he kind of demonstrated that olive branch extension. But I'm not seeing from these other lawmakers --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: On Saturday Night Live. The other thing is in terms of like -- I understand that she's young. I can get it. But, you know what? She won an election. She's in a position of leadership and power and there's responsibility with that. And I have spoken on the record my entire career, sometimes on behalf of other people in the last 10 years for myself. I can remember one time when I was taken out of context, and the reason for that is because I'm thoughtful about what I'm going to say. Every week she complains about being taken out of context.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You are thoughtful -- hold it a second. You are thoughtful. But you know what the difference is? Here for the first time in history you have two Muslim women in the Congress of the United States. They carry an enormous burden. It's not just their personal lives or their districts, they're representing four million, five million Muslims in the United States. There's a lot there. There's a lot of responsibility there. They're growing in the job. It is --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Do they have a great platform?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: They have a great platform.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What are they using their platform for?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah, I mean, I don't see religion. So I actually resent -- I just listen to the words. I will say this on her behalf. She's guilty of what a lot of us do when we're in front of a friendly audience. We just get casual. She has to learn that her audience isn't as casual any more. She has a diverse group of people out there. People like Jesse, and Geraldo, and Emily, and what's your name again? Dana? And so, it's not just going to be CAIR. Like, you can talk like that in front of CAIR, but you --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Was that CAIR calling? CAIR calling.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You know what? I think we have to go. Roll the song please.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, it's one of those --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Robo-calls?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- robo-calls.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: This is a song I picked for myself for all of you. And all of you. Do you know this song?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: This is Garth Brooks, friends in low places. Do you know this song, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Listen, pick up the tune. You've got friends in low places.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah, one is Dana. She's about five feet tall.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And Greg about 4'8.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: (INAUDIBLE) illegal immigrants in sanctuary cities, hear from him, next.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's hard to be humble, Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's hard to be humble when you're perfect in every way. I thought this was a great song for you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Because I'm so humble.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That was Mack Davis.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That wasn't sarcastic at all, OK. Thank you, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The internet helped me.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. Wait, people voted that I'm cocky?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Thank you, Geraldo. Fashion police. It's a big day for Democrats who've been raving about how great sanctuary cities are for years.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Sanctuary policies actually make cities safer.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: To be clear about what Chicago is, it always will be a sanctuary city.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Together let us build a house stronger than the oncoming storms, yet open to the world, the house that provides shelter to all who need it and sanctuary to all who seek it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: President Trump ready to give these liberals exactly what they've always wanted by saying he may dump illegal immigrants in their cities.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT
utterances.utterance: We could fix that in so fast if the Democrats would agree. But if they don't agree we might as well do what they always say they want. We'll bring them to sanctuary- city areas and let that particular area take care of it whether it's a state or whatever it might be. California is certainly is always saying, oh, we want more people and they want more people in their sanctuary cities. Well, we'll give them more people. We can give them a lot. We can give them an unlimited supply, and let's see if they're so happy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Nancy Pelosi's home district in San Francisco is reportedly one of the areas that the White House discussed, but for some reason the House Speaker is upset about it.

utterances.speaker: REP. NANCY PELOSI, D-CALIF., SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE
utterances.utterance: I don't know anything about it. But again, it's just another notion that is unworthy of the Presidency of the United States, and disrespectful to challenges that we face as a country, as a people, to address who we are, a nation of immigrants.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, Geraldo, I don't know if this idea is actually going to happen, but it does serve the purpose of illustrating the hypocrisy from some of the Democrats in this country who say, yes, bring them in, provides sanctuary, but just not in my city.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Let me start by agreeing that I think that a lot of what the president is saying is born of frustration because of the lack of cooperation by the Democrats on the border.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: They're doing nothing to help other than making things more difficult. But this is a stunt. You're not going to take -- this is also illegal. I'm telling you. It is illegal.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Ask Emily. You cannot use people as props to do and make a political point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's what they've been doing for 40 years.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: This is --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Democrats and Republicans.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: The road from the border to wherever the illegal immigrants are being taken will be lined with lawsuits. I guarantee you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK. Emily, I think the restriction is financial. You can't just spend -- it cost a lot of money to transport people all the way from the border to San Francisco.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Yes. One of the limitations on it would be budgetary in terms of whether it's considered legal. I want to point out that I just think the biggest issue to me is that the Democrats aren't listening to local law enforcement, and they are not listening to regular people. It's such a top-down discussion. And that is why there's such friction at the local community level that people are upset about. Do you remember in February when -- the woman, Larson, was like brutally murdered by a six-time civil detainer request, illegal immigrant. He had a history of violent felonies, etcetera. It was -- you know, it's kind of one of those token case of which, unfortunately, there are a lot. Point, guess what happened on Tuesday. The Santa Clara County administration voted overwhelmingly to soften the sanctuary policy because the point is those policies harm communities in multiple ways, including the immigrant community because it doesn't provide the clarity that they can use to understand how and when they can immigrate legally. And so, in Santa Clara County they're basically -- they're voting to soften it. And, as they say, the immigration laws there are dysfunctional, everyone is confused. And as I always say, whose job is it then to clarify? Get to it, legislators. Instead of squawking about it, go do your job and clarify the policy, and then we can all survive.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This headline from the Washington Post, White House want -- wanted border detainees released in sanctuary cities to target Trump foes, so even the media is portraying the very policies that they claim to love as punishment. I mean -- they're actually mad at Trump for giving them what they asked for. Let's say it's a stunt. Let's say it's a bad idea. The fact is if you don't like having these released illegal immigrants there you have to explain why because this is your policy. You have created this problem. So, if Pelosi thinks it's a stunt -- don't say it's illegal, say why don't you want them there?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, that's a great thing. If you're a reporter in Washington, Pelosi gives her Thursday press conference. Why don't they ask Nancy Pelosi that?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's going to be a doozy next week. She's going to have a lot to answer for. There's going to be lots of things. A couple of things, first of all, I don't think that this policy, even if it's a stunt, let's say it's implemented. I don't think it stops the flow of migrants coming to the border.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Because they're like, oh, well, then maybe we get to go to San Francisco?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Santa Barbara.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's still -- because it is given. Like, they should embrace it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I just mean it's not going to address the real problems the president says. The major problem is the migrant crisis at the border.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We're being overwhelmed. We don't have enough resources, that's one thing. The other thing is it reminds me of bridge-gate, using your political levers in order to attack your political enemies. And, again, his -- I don't think that the president's base needs firing up. I get that it's a great point like it does plays mind games with the Democrats. Like, really? Then what about you? What are you going to do? The other thing I would say is if the administration who denied this up until two hours before the president tweeted it and say it was going to happen, don't brainstorm in emails. Brainstorm in person, not in emails.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I just think -- I don't think you can compare it to bridge-gate. I think that it was probably an idea that they put forth. But I do think it does make progress because you're going to force the Democrats to either embrace or deviate from a policy that they believe hypothetically. Make it a reality.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Why not get the Democrats to cooperate with you?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Let the president call -- I love the president, but he's tempestuous and he's thin-skinned. He should call up Chuck Schumer.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Sounds familiar.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Call him up and say, hey, listen, dude. Let's do something before we're really in the heat of the presidential election. We've got a million people coming across the southern border. There is the crisis of which you spoke.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: OK. To that point, we've had two parties that never solved this problem because they never wanted to. This is --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Agreed.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And Trump being essentially apolitical, let's face it. He was a Democrat for a long time. He's a Republican because it makes sense. He is the first person really to say let's try to solve it for good. He's being the adult in the room.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't think that's fair. I think that there are -- definitely - - look, I worked for George W. Bush. He wanted to solve that problem. The deal that was on the table is the one that's probably going to be the one that is going to be solidified. The people on the extremes, right and left, are the ones that don't want the deal, and that's what pulls people apart. I think President Trump could make this deal tomorrow.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: And that's why George W. Bush got 44 percent of the Latino vote.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That wasn't the reason why to do it. I mean, he wanted the border security, but --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK. Any more songs to make fun of?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: This is not making fun of you. This is actually a compliment.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, thank you.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: This one is for fun.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's called -- this is Dierks Bentley --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- am I the only one that wants to have fun tonight?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, liberals continuing to melt down over Attorney General Barr saying the Trump campaign was spied on, see their latest hysteria next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: There you go. I didn't even know that. Charlie Daniels for you.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: The last 2 1/2 years as you, folks, we have watched the FBI's relentless probe of allege collusion between President Trump and the Russians to rig the 2016 election. Now, that comes up empty. The hunter though is becoming the hunted now as William Barr, the new attorney general declares he will investigate how this whole bogus thing got started. You can imagine that does not sit well with those who cheered on the probe, that was apparent and the reaction to the attorney general's comments that the Trump campaign had indeed been spied on by the FBI.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: The attorney general did exactly what President Trump wanted. He dodged questions, held a conspiracy theory, and like the president, lobbed baseless accusations.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I don't think he's acting in the best interests of the attorney general -- of the justice department, or of the country.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: The former fired FBI Director James Comey is reacting by also saying Barr's claim of spying is completely off base.

utterances.speaker: JAMES COMEY, FORMER FBI DIRECTOR
utterances.utterance: I really don't know what he's talking about when he talked about spying on the campaign. When I hear that kind of language used, it's concerning, because the FBI, the Department of Justice conduct court-ordered electronic surveillance. I have never thought of that as spying. The Attorney General has come to the belief that that should be called spying. Wow, that's going to require a whole lot of conversations inside the Department of Justice.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: That's spying, yes it's spying. You should know that the outgoing Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein has come to William Barr, his boss' - new boss' defense saying in a rare interview with The Wall Street Journal that it is "completely bizarre" that people think the Attorney General is trying to mislead the public. They really are just worried in the media and in government, all these people that promoted this phony notion for over two years that they will be exposed and embarrassed, that they will be called out on it, don't you think?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: More than just embarrassed, there's criminal referrals now being tossed around and I thought Juan was going to be here today-- --because all week Juan has been saying, Jesse, there was never spying, you are a liar, stop misleading the audience. And I printed out all of this mainstream media article, The Washington Post, The New York Times, The Journal, all calling these people--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: National Review.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: --National Review, FBI paid informants, secret surveillance. I mean all of this stuff, the media--

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Wiretap.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: --has been saying that they've been doing, and now the media does not even believe their own reporting.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I think that the cat is out of the bag. It will be very embarrassing. Emily, don't you think, here they have promoted the notion that our President was a traitor, that our President was a spy for the Russians, that he was an asset of Vladimir Putin. Now they have to take it back, now they have to - I think be exposed in a way that would be extremely embarrassing, if not at risk of some jail time.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Yes, and what is difficult to reconcile to me too are these - you know members or former members of law enforcement of our country and of the DoJ, why wouldn't they be behind the process, why wouldn't Jim Comey, former director, say yes I support the notion that if there is concern that the government is overreaching in limits, if there is concern that there is - there are warrantless and unreasonable searches and seizures occurring, then yes I support an investigation into that. I would think they would be and should be the model for not making conclusions before the entire investigation has been completed. But unfortunately, this type of hypocrisy we've seen the entire time.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Dana, it reminds me of someone like a trapeze artist who was swinging and they jumped for the other bar--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And they miss it?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: --the bar of collusion and it didn't exist.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And there's no net.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: And there's no net.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And then--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There is a net, it's called the media.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, I was thinking that the media was included in that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: The media is definitely included, it's definitely included.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I do wonder it for Rod Rosenstein, if he feels like he's checked into Hotel California, he wanted to resign two months ago and like now he's still there defending everyone.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I was very surprised that he came public. He didn't have to defend William Barr at this stage of--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But I think that he is - I think that he's a true civil servant, does a good job, and I don't think he does it just out of loyalty, I think it does it on the merits.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Would you care, Greg, if it did not amount to criminal conduct but just was embarrassing to The New York Times. New York Times and Washington Post who won the Pulitzer Prize--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But they're reporting on this list. Are they going to give it back?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't know. I mean, obviously the real collusion was the media and the Democrats, let's - and by the way, have you noticed that Comey has become even more irritating.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That was amazing. That sound on tape seems like it went on forever. You know what a great prank would be, never let this die down. We should now embrace the idea of Russian collusion just - and then start sending anonymous tips to CNN and say don't let it go, it's working really well for you, keep pushing it. The funny thing is they have gone from accusing - I've said this before - they've gone from believing that there was a spy in the White House to arguing over the semantics of the word spy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's how desperate. So my tip to the media is find a new story. There's some really exciting stuff out there, artificial intelligence, terror and technology, loss of privacy, I know but it doesn't sell. This is profit driven divisive media.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Should they be response - should they really be called out in a way that embarrasses them for wasting so much time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Talk about the most thin-skinned profession on earth will never happen.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And also it is the profession that gives themselves more awards than Hollywood.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's true. Every day is the Oscars.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: It's so intramural too. They give it to their buddies.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They write for each other.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Well they do stories in order to impress their other peers, that's all it's about.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Absolutely, and they tweet for each other too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Lori Loughlin reportedly defiant in the college admissions scandal. Chicago officially hits Jussie Smollett with a lawsuit for over $100,000. Michael Avenatti faces 335 years behind bars. Guess how many times he was on CNN? It's all in our legal roundup next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Listen to your song is, If I Had a Boat.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Twice a year, well that's good song for you, Emily.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Alright, updates in three legal stories we've been covering. First up Lori Loughlin reportedly thinks she did what any mother would have done in the college admissions scandal. Loughlin also doesn't believe she broke the law, even though she's facing 40 years in prison. Now this is Massachusetts top federal prosecutor who says some of the other parents charged in the scheme are trying to get a new judge assigned to the case who would view them more favorably. Right, Geraldo, let's start with you.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Well first of all, judge shopping, every good lawyer does it, and to think that you get the same justice from every judge is ridiculous, naive, and the voice of inexperience. The other thing I want to say is that the actress Lori Loughlin and the - you know I had many people, clients and the friends of clients, who when it comes time to justice to be meted out, and they really know now that they're facing actual time in prison, it's an awakening that has a real sobering effect on you. Panic sets in, you'd never ever thought of yourself - I mean just think, two three months ago, she was on top of the world. She was doing these movies for The Hallmark Channel and everything else and had wonderful recognition.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's top of the world? Oh my God.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But I heard she was very good.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kill me.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: She's very successful, don't be so stunned. She's very successful and suddenly her whole world has collapsed and her own children now look at her as the instruments of their own humiliation. It is a horrible, horrible thing. I feel nothing but pitiful for her.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, she was also on Full House, which is a pretty sitcom--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: From the Full House. Such an old trike (ph) joke I couldn't resist.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh yes, I think I used that line in my weekend show. Which we haven't filmed yet. I like judge shopping, I like the concept of it, I like clothes shopping, I like all kinds of shopping. And I think lawyers have the right to do that. But I do think she's getting bad legal advice, because all the other people involved, they took the deal, she didn't, and her lawyer should have known better.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Maybe she wasn't offered a deal.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think she--

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Remember, she gave $500,000. Felicity gave $15,000.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's true, but I think any good lawyer could have--

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Come on.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: --got her into that basket.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I would say one thing important to remember, ignorance is not a defense, the truth is.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Nice.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: How about that?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: All right, up next-- You said you didn't have any thoughts on it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh thanks Emily, now I know where you stand.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: I'll come to you first with this, so Chicago making good on its promise to sue Jussie Smollett for more than $130,000. This comes after the actor refused to reimburse the city to cover the cost of investigating an attack that police say he orchestrated, and also he was indicted by a grand jury. So, Greg, what are your thoughts?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What did you just say? Smollett is a joke, but I'm going to sound like a broken record. He only responded to what the media offered him. If you want to - if you want to move somewhere fast, there were two stories, what we're going to get to the Kavanaugh stuff. The Kavanaugh smear helped Avenatti and the hate crime hoax helped Smollett. Smollett just figured out, you know I can be bigger than what I am. So I don't necessarily say it's entirely his fault. The media took this for everything and he knew he could get away with it, and he still might.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Oh I think that that is such a superficial analysis.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh thank you, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I mean I really--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Will you accuse somebody of superficiality?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Emmett Till came from Chicago. He was lynched for flirting with a white woman in Mississippi on vacation. This is a very serious thing. When a black man takes the history of this country and use it to his own benefit.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh I'm not saying it's a joke.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: This guy is - this is far more serious than these people trying to chisel their kids into college.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I agree. That's why I have no comment.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Punished, I'm for punishment.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think he should not have gone to Hawaii right now. I think that's really just thumbing his nose in the face of the police officers that spent a long time trying to track down the real perpetrators and now nothing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Maybe we'll find a lost tiki doll, when he's surfing.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: All right, you guys, let's get this real fast.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's a Brady Bunch reference.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Finally, Michael Avenatti is facing 335 years in prison after being hit with 36 new federal charges for allegedly stealing millions from his clients, not paying taxes and committing bank fraud. Geraldo?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: He is my least favorite public person on earth.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Wow.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I despise Michael Avenatti. And for me to say that, for me to go there, there's a lot of people I'm jumping over to get to Michael Avenatti, the single most obnoxious person.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: He leveraged his way to notoriety--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Even more than Kilmeade?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: --by exploiting Stormy Daniels. I mean look, he used Stormy Daniels to pole-vault on to the media. Then he became a fixture, because he is articulate and charismatic in the cable news sense of the word. He got on television a lot. CNN put him on 121 times, MSNBC put him on 108 times; I mean this is an exploiter, a bum. He really should be--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Here's a question, CNN--

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: He stole money from disabled clients.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: CNN or don't go chase some lady who exchanged emails with a Russian bot, how come nobody is trying to find out where Julie Swetnick went? Where is Julie Swetnick? I Google her name you know every week or so just to find out if she's been arrested or what is she doing. Is that weird?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Who is she again?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: She was the face--

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Kavanaugh.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Kavanaugh gang rape victim.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Oh my goodness.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: That Michael Avenatti promoted.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Last word on Avenatti?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I would just say that I have two shows on Fox and he's been on TV more than I have. That's a lot.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: All right, you guys, got to go. Fan Mail Friday is up next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well they didn't get the best part, which is, Here's a Quarter Call Someone Who Cares, live from Travis Tritt.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh blaming the producers.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Not really, no I love--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Somebody's not coming to work on Monday. All right, first question, Rita G. Name three things that are always by your bedside. Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Okay, well a book. Right now, I'm reading Shannon Bream's galley, it's called Finding the Bright Side, it's coming out. I have eye drops, you know. I have aquifer (ph) but I also have some - I have - do you have the yoga toes?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Yes, I do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What are yoga toes?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: They are - they are by the table by the TV, so I put them in when I'm watching, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What are yoga - you put them in between your toes?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Yes, but they're silicone, they feel really good and they stretch all your toes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's just creepy.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: If you wore heels, you would-

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I do and I don't need them. But I only wear heels on one night a week at a certain bar. Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I have The Gutfeld Monologues; Liars, Leakers and Liberals.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Liars, Liberals and Leakers.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And a phone charger.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Phone charger. Geraldo?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: The phone, because I have five kids and four grandkids, water and nose spray. I would go on to other things, but I can only say them in certain states.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Oh wow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Emily, we know you have yoga whatevers.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: No, those are in front of TV. So, yes I have books too and the one I'm reading right now is called Incendiary and it's about the mad bomber in New York in the 1950s, which is totally fascinating and (inaudible) it was over 15 years. And also the remote control for the window thing at the top, and then--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh I have that too.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: And an eye mask.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh I have that too. Our beds are like the same.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I would name three things, but I can't remember what their names are. All right, what scared you as a child? This is from Derek L. Emily?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: That my family would move, while I was at school. I had this weird fear and every day it was very - a very real fear and so every day I was like, will somebody come and pick me up or they moved when I was--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, how long did this fear last?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do you still have it?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: No, I don't. Now everyone has cell phones, I can get hold of them.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Wow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Geraldo?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Vampires.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Vampires?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Vampires. You know, I'm a city kid, so when we went camping, I worried that the vampires would come get me, because you told ghost stories and--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: How ironic, you became a lawyer. He joined the other side. Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I was afraid of Geraldo as a kid.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Me too.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Clowns and dogs.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Clowns and dogs. How about a very hairy clown, that must have been very scary, clown with a tail.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And now you are not scared of dogs.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's right, I got over that fear. Well, I'm still terrified.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The Wicked Witch of the West.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh yes, everybody did.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I had to go into my mom and dad's room, I couldn't take it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, that was a frightening frightening movie, people forget about that. You know what I'm scared, going to prison, because I grew up on--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: For snoring?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: (LAUGHTER) I grew up a cop shows.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You don't want to go to jail?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So I was - I had the wrong sense of proportion on going to jail, because I watched Dragnet and Adam-12 and all those shows. So I thought that like everybody went to jail, everybody. And in every - in comedies, people were in prison.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Just Avenatti.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Just Avenatti. All right, all right, all right, One More Thing is up next. What's the song?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: John Denver, Rocky Mountain High. You liked it?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Love it.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: He also did a concert.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You like that song, right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Rocky Mountain High?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I wasn't listening.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That song, contemporary, Rocky Mountain High, I picked it just for you. Darn it, but anyway, we had country music today. And next week, we have a very exciting news. “The Five,” all of - we are going to Nashville. We will be live from the Wildhorse Saloon. John Rich will be joining us at the table. Also Kathie Lee Gifford joining us and we are going to have the best time. This is Tuesday, April 16 in Nashville. Tickets are not needed to attend. So, if you want to come see us, that is where we will be. Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Bring booze. All right. The Great Gutfeld Show, tomorrow night, 10 O'clock, great show. I've got Charlie here, Tom Shillue, Kat Timpf, Tyrus. That's Saturday, April 13, 10 PM. Be there or I will never speak to you again. I think I have time for this, don't I?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Animals are grazing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, it has been a while.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It has been a while. We haven't done this. Mule makes me happy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Mule makes me happy. Two dogs having fun. Two dogs playing with a balloon

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, great.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Look at that. You know what's amazing? That balloon weighs 200 pounds and it--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They are pretty good.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, they are pretty good. They are actually--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Have fun.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They're just little people dressed in dog outfits.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Wow.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: And they take turns.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That is - really, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Isn't that nice?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Wow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You'd learn a lot from these two dogs.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: This is like congress should watch this.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Let's just keep watching this forever.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I can't stop watching this. All right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's amazing. Do you want to do your little thing at the end?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's good.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Okay, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I would like to wish my mother a very happy birthday.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Happy birthday, mummy!

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Happy birthday, Jesse's mom!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It is her birthday today. Dr. Watters, I should correctly address her.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: She's in Maine today and I called her to say happy birthday, and she said she got the cable fixed on the TV and she said every station comes in clear except Fox News.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Conspiracy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And I - Yes, something I don't know what's going on there. But anyway--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She should have been a marine biologist. Dr. Watters.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Dr. Watters. Someone in my family needed a degree. I wasn't getting one.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You didn't graduate?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Not with a PhD.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Oh there.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Also my weekend show, 8 o'clock, we have Mike Rowe. I'm developing a man crush on him.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Okay, he's great.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I love that guy. Also obviously, Diamond and Silk everybody. They are very mad at DL Hughley, he took a huge shot at them, and Candace Owens we have and Dan Crenshaw.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Terrific.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, that's a great show. All right. Emily?.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Okay. You guys check out this video where a heroic border collie dog dashes behind a moving car in order to save a Chihuahua.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Let's play that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Wait, what - how--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That really happened?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Literally.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Awesome.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Wow, that sounds staged.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: They didn't know.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Wow, Geraldo, you go.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I have to quick do this. I live in Cleveland, great town on the rebound. Cleveland Clinic, a tremendous asset. For the 17th year in a row, they did the Minority Men's Health Fair.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, cool.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: It is free. You know, black and brown men suffer disproportionately from diseases like the diabetes, high blood pressure--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Heart disease.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Cholesterol, heart disease, all of it. I was glad to work with Dr. Charles Modlin, the wonderful founder of the Minority Men's Health Fair.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's so cool.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: My second year and I'll be there every year.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Going forward.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right. That's a great thing to do.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: That's cool.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right. Well, we have had fun with music week. I think everybody had fun. I mean can't wait to be in Nashville next week. Hope you will join us there. That's it for us now. We will be back here on Monday as well, not just Tuesday. Have a great weekend. Content and Programming Copyright 2019 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.
